Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is running for the Democratic presidential nomination against Joe Biden. While he is unlikely to win, he has earned his high profile due to his environmental record and his ability to capture the attention of audiences. Kennedy has also been vocal about his anti-vax crusade and has accused Dr. Anthony Fauci of using the pandemic to trigger a “coup d’état against Western democracy.” Kennedy has also been critical of Biden's pandemic restrictions, which his wife Cheryl Hines disagreed with. Despite this, Kennedy has stated that he bears no ill will to any of them. Kennedy is running in the presidential primaries, and if he wins, many dissatisfied Democrats may be tempted to look his way. However, Kennedy has stated that he will not run as a third-party candidate, which could have thrown the race to someone none of his supporters wanted.

  1. Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is running for the Democratic presidential nomination against Joe Biden.
  2. Kennedy has claimed that Covid vaccinations are responsible for practically every evil in the world.
  3. Kennedy has a history of environmental activism and was once a popular figure.
  4. Kennedy is running in the Democratic primaries, not as a third-party candidate.
  5. Kennedy has made controversial claims about prescription drugs and school shootings.

"It's like a marathon runner, once celebrated for their environmental activism, entering a race against the current champion, making wild claims about the water and track conditions to gain attention."
